sentence: You can achieve anything with hard work.
hint: To successfully finish something.

sentence: Exercise has many health benefits.
hint: An advantage or profit gained from something.

sentence: Climbing the mountain was a big challenge.
hint: A task that tests someone's ability.

sentence: Can you describe your hometown?
hint: To give a detailed account of something.

sentence: Water is essential for life.
hint: Completely necessary; extremely important.

sentence: I have a flexible schedule today.
hint: Able to be easily modified to respond to altered circumstances.

sentence: The company has seen rapid growth.
hint: The process of increasing in size or importance.

sentence: Brushing your teeth is a good habit.
hint: A settled or regular tendency or practice.

sentence: I want to improve my English skills.
hint: To make or become better.

sentence: The journey to the north took three days.
hint: An act of traveling from one place to another.

sentence: He has a great knowledge of history.
hint: Information and skills acquired through experience.

sentence: There is a speed limit on this road.
hint: A point or level beyond which something may not extend.

sentence: Can you manage this project alone?
hint: To be in charge of; to succeed in doing something.

sentence: Did you notice any changes?
hint: To become aware of something.

sentence: What is your opinion on this movie?
hint: A view or judgment formed about something.

sentence: We anticipate a large crowd at the event.
hint: To expect or predict something.

sentence: Language can be a barrier to communication.
hint: A circumstance that keeps people apart.

sentence: This is a comprehensive study of the topic.
hint: Complete; including all or nearly all elements.

sentence: It's hard to distinguish between the twins.
hint: To recognize or treat as different.

sentence: The teacher will evaluate your performance.
hint: To form an idea of the amount or value of.

sentence: The stock prices fluctuate every day.
hint: To rise and fall irregularly in number or amount.

sentence: The product comes with a two-year guarantee.
hint: A formal promise or assurance.

sentence: The scientist proposed a new hypothesis.
hint: A proposed explanation made on the basis of limited evidence.

sentence: Change is inevitable in life.
hint: Certain to happen; unavoidable.

sentence: Can you justify your decision?
hint: To show or prove to be right or reasonable.

sentence: You need to maintain a healthy diet.
hint: To keep something at a consistent level.

sentence: They had to negotiate a new contract.
hint: To try to reach an agreement by discussion.

sentence: Our primary objective is to increase sales.
hint: A thing aimed at or sought; a goal.

sentence: He tried to persuade me to join the club.
hint: To convince someone to do something.

sentence: Is this information relevant to our case?
hint: Closely connected or appropriate to what is being done.

sentence: The region has abundant natural resources.
hint: Existing or available in large quantities.

sentence: The red car was very conspicuous.
hint: Clearly visible; attracting notice or attention.

sentence: The weather began to deteriorate rapidly.
hint: To become progressively worse.

sentence: He gave an eloquent speech at the wedding.
hint: Fluent or persuasive in speaking or writing.

sentence: The opponent was a formidable player.
hint: Inspiring fear or respect through being large or powerful.

sentence: There is a strict hierarchy in the army.
hint: A system in which members are ranked according to status.

sentence: He seemed indifferent to the news.
hint: Having no particular interest or sympathy.

sentence: This is a very lucrative business.
hint: Producing a great deal of profit.

sentence: She is meticulous about her work.
hint: Showing great attention to detail; very careful.

sentence: The old photos filled her with nostalgia.
hint: A sentimental longing for the past.

sentence: The meaning of the poem is obscure.
hint: Not discovered or known about; uncertain.

sentence: The disease is prevalent in tropical areas.
hint: Widespread in a particular area or at a particular time.

sentence: She is a resilient person who recovers quickly.
hint: Able to withstand or recover quickly from difficult conditions.

sentence: The lawyer will scrutinize every document.
hint: To examine or inspect closely and thoroughly.

sentence: We need tangible evidence to prove the case.
hint: Perceptible by touch; clear and real.

sentence: The instructions were quite ambiguous.
hint: Open to more than one interpretation; unclear.

sentence: The king was known as a benevolent leader.
hint: Well meaning and kindly.

sentence: The witness will corroborate your story.
hint: To confirm or give support to a statement.

sentence: The internet helps to disseminate information.
hint: To spread or disperse something widely.

sentence: The cold weather will exacerbate your cough.
hint: To make a problem or bad situation worse.
